title: Angular impulse - two forces exerted on board

content.question: Two forces of equal magnitude are exerted at separate times to a board that is initially at rest and free to rotate about an axis at one end of the board, as shown in the figures. In Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, a force of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> is exerted perpendicular to the board at the center of the board for a time <math alttext="2 t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></math>, after which the board has a final angular momentum about the axis of magnitude <math alttext="uppercase L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. In Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the board is returned to rest at its initial position and a force of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> is exerted at a constant angle to the board of <math alttext="60 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>60</mn><mo>âˆ˜</mo></msup></math> at the end of the board for time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>, after which the board has a final angular momentum about the axis of magnitude <math alttext="uppercase L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following is equal to the ratio <math alttext="The ratio uppercase L sub 2, to uppercase L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="The ratio 1 to the fraction 2 over the square root of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>:</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt></mfrac></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
